intro: Polpoda capensis, commonly known as the Cape polpoda, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal regions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are usually pale green to white in color. Polpoda capensis is adapted to thrive in arid conditions, making it a hardy species in its native habitat.
